Sentencas: This study investigates the innovative use of a deposition technique, spray coating, for the fabrication of optimal thicknesses of solid oxide cell (SOC) layers on a range of SOC-compatible materials.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The work has been carried out as part of the European KEROGREEN project that aims to utilize CO2 into sustainable aircraft kerosene.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: To separate the oxygen at higher operating temperatures after CO2 dissociation (plasmolysis) for creating a CO stream for Fischer-Tropsch downstream synthesis, a solid oxide electrolyzer cell is used.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: For the electrodes, the most promising LaSr-based perovskite materials were selected based on their electrical conductivity and ability to suppress the CO to CO2 back reaction at the CO2 (plasma) splitting side.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The spray-coating suspension was adjusted to improve the adhesion and quality of the adjacent SOC layers.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The electrode coatings showed good adhesion to the yttria-stabilized zirconia electrolyte, with a thickness of 10-15 mu m and porosity of circa 45%.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Prior to the electrodes, thin and dense interlayers were spray coated to prevent reactions between the electrolyte and the electrodes.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: These interlayers reduced the total electrodes resistance of the SOEC.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The LaSr-based CO2 electrode powder and spray-coated SOEC remained stable in the CO2/CO/O-2 environment.
Titulo: Development of thin electrode layers by spray coating for solid oxide cells
